message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should feature a display of a standard template element which might include a title, description, and possibly a placeholder for dynamic content. This component is ideal for scenarios where a template is predefined but will be utilized dynamically for various content. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **TemplateCard**: Standalone component - **ContentPlaceholder**: Component that takes children. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

This is placeholder content which will be dynamically replaced.
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **TemplateCard**: ```html

{title}

{description}

``` - **ContentPlaceholder**: ```html

```

prompt: Footer with links to policies, terms, and help

message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should present a footer section at the bottom of the webpage that contains three hyperlinks: "Policies", "Terms", and "Help". These links should be horizontally aligned on desktop screens and stack vertically on mobile devices. Each link should have appropriate padding and be visually distinct. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **FooterContainer** (Standalone): This component acts as a container for the footer content. - **FooterLink** (Standalone): Represents a single hyperlink within the footer that navigates to a policy, term, or help page. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
Policies Terms Help
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **FooterContainer**: ```html
{children}
``` - **FooterLink**: ```html {children} ```

prompt: List of options that appears when a user clicks or hovers over a button or link

message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should feature a button or link that, when clicked or hovered over, reveals a dropdown list of options. The list should appear directly beneath the button or link and be vertically aligned with the start of the button or link. It should be styled minimally with clear visual separation between each option. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **DropdownButton** (standalone): This component represents the button that triggers the dropdown list. - **DropdownMenu** (takes children): This is the container for the list of options that appears when the DropdownButton is activated. - **DropdownItem** (takes children): Represents a single option within the DropdownMenu. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
Option 1 Option 2 Option 3
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **DropdownButton**: ```html ``` - **DropdownMenu**: ```html
{children}
``` - **DropdownItem**: ```html {children} ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should consist of a navigation bar across the top of the page that includes labeled icons that represent different sections of the website. This navigation bar should be responsive, meaning it adjusts nicely to different screen sizes. Each icon, along with its label, should be clickable. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **NavBar**: Standalone component that acts as a container for the navigation items. - **NavItem**: Component that takes children; represents a single labeled icon within the NavBar. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
home Home info About contact_mail Contact

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI for the Savings Calculator tool should feature a simple, clean layout with an input form where users can enter their initial savings amount, monthly deposit, and interest rate. Below the form, there should be a display area where the estimated savings total after a specified number of years is shown. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **InputForm** (Standalone): A component containing input fields for the initial savings, monthly deposit, and interest rate, along with a submit button. - **SavingsDisplay** (Standalone): A component to display the calculated savings after a certain number of years. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

prompt: Expanded menu displaying a wide range of navigation options or content categories

message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should feature an expanded menu, which is prominently displayed, containing a variety of navigation links categorized by different content categories. The menu should be easy to read and navigate, ideally in a column-based layout, with clear headings for each category and links listed under these headings. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **MenuContainer** (Standalone): This component encapsulates the entire menu, setting the general layout and style. - **CategoryHeader** (Standalone): Represents the heading for each category within the menu. - **NavLink** (Standalone): This component represents individual navigational links under each category. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
Category 1
  • Link 1
  • Link 2
Category 2
  • Link 1
  • Link 2
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **MenuContainer**: ```html
{children}
``` - **CategoryHeader**: ```html

{children}

``` - **NavLink**: ```html {children} ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should feature a mega menu which typically consists of a large dropdown menu containing multiple columns of content. These can include links, images, and even descriptive text organized under different categories. The mega menu should appear when hovering over a main menu item and should be easily navigated, clearly sectioned, and styled for readability. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **NavBar (Standalone)**: This component acts as the container for the navigation items. - **NavItem (Children)**: Represents each item in the nav bar that can trigger a dropdown content when hovered. - **MegaMenuDropdown (Children)**: The dropdown content that appears when a NavItem is hovered. It organizes the content into columns and sections. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
Products Services About Us
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **NavBar**: ```html
    {children}
``` - **NavItem**: ```html
  • {children}
    {children}
    • ``` - **MegaMenuDropdown**: ```html
    {children}
    ``` The NavItem has a hover trigger that displays the MegaMenuDropdown, using CSS transitions for smooth appearance. The MegaMenuDropdown component would contain organized content in a grid layout to showcase multiple columns, facilitating clear navigation. Each column in the MegaMenuDropdown can be further customized and divided based on content type or category.

prompt: Highlighted box drawing attention to important information or announcements

message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should feature a highlighted box that stands out visually from the rest of the content, meant to draw attention to important information or announcements. This box should include a title and the body text. The design should be noticeable but not overwhelming and should be easily distinguishable due to its background color, padding, and possibly a border. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **HighlightedBox (Standalone)**: This component will contain the major elements of the highlighted information box, including a title and body text. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **HighlightedBox** ```html

Important Announcement

{announcement_body}

``` Replace `{announcement_body}` with the specific text of the announcement when known. This setup uses warning colors (yellows) to signify importance but can be adjusted according to the severity or nature of the announcement.
